page.title: 09HIGHAM FERRERS' ROYAL VISIT
page.content:
The smile of the Queen warmed the heart of Northamptonshire on the 3rd May 1985. The Queen and Duke of Edinburgh arrived in a Rolls Royce. The Queen was wearing a blue coat and hat with a black handbag and white gloves.
The streets were lined with flag waving crowds, flags and banners covered the shops and houses. The Royal Couple were greeted by loud cheers as they were introduced to the Mayor and Mayoress. During a walkabout , Prince Philip picked a child up so that she could give the Queen some flowers.
A bouquet was presented by a sixth former from the Ferrers School, who said she was so excited it brought tears to her eyes. The royal couple then went on to visit farms on Duchy land nearby.
